Basic Tables

  • Add summary="" information to the <table> element to give users more context on how the table is structured. This is especially useful when your table is complex.
  • Add the <caption> element before the table content to give users more information on the table contents. Think of it as a headline for your table.
  • Wrap your column headers (th elements) in <thead> to group them together. Each column header should also include a scope="col" attribute.
  • If your table includes row headers, include a scope="row" attribute to the row header (th elements).
  • The table content should be wrapped in a <tbody> element.

Resources

  • Responsive Data Table Roundup
  • Web Accessibility Tutorials - Table Concepts

WCAG 2.0 Guidelines

1.3.1 Info and Relationships - Information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined or are available in text.
